intro: Marsdenia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
